wikipedia_page.main:
Major-General Sir Alexander Nelson Rochfort  (3 June 1850  – 5 December 1916) was a British Army officer who became Lieutenant Governor of Jersey.
Rochfort was born in County Carlow, Ireland, the fifth son of Horace William Noel Rochfort and Hon. Charlotte Hood, daughter of Samuel Hood, 2nd Baron Bridport.

response: *Alexander Rochfort KCB CMG (1850–1916), British Army officer who became Lieutenant Governor of Jersey

According to a war report by British army colonel Alexander Rochfort, Dhowre Ali Sheneeleh was the most senior governor or commander at the southernmost Dervish base at Qollad, near present day Hiran, whereupon he clashed with an Abyssinian force allied to the British:
